article.description: MaCio Teague scored 18 points and Ahmad Thomas scored his 1,000th career point as UNC-Asheville maintained a share of the Big South Conference lead by routing Presbyterian 89-48 on Wednesday nigh
article.headline: Big South leader UNC-Asheville routs of Presbyterian, 89-48
article.linkText: Big South leader UNC-Asheville routs of Presbyterian, 89-48
article.story: ASHEVILLE, N.C. -- MaCio Teague scored 18 points and Ahmad Thomas scored his 1,000th career point as UNC-Asheville maintained a share of the Big South Conference lead by routing Presbyterian 89-48 on Wednesday night. The Bulldogs, who won at home for the 12th time in 13 games, remains tied with idle Liberty atop the Big South standings. UNC-Asheville has three games remaining in its regular season, including a showdown at home with Liberty in the finale. Teague hit 7 of 11 from the field, including 4 of 7 from beyond the arc, to lead the Bulldogs (21-7, 13-2). Thomas entered the game with 988 career points and scored 14. Raekwon Miller had 15 points. UNC-Asheville shot 55.1 percent from the field in the game, including 51.9 percent from beyond the arc. Reggie Dillard scored 14 points to lead Presbyterian (5-21, 1-14), and JC Younger added another 13.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
